qas.question: Ethnic affiliation of who has become an ideological conflict?
The idea of "Carpatho-Ruthenian" nation is supported only by Lemkos residing where?
Most inhabitants of historic Moravia considered themselves as what?
What group is considered part of the Poles?
What is the ethnic affiliation of the Rusyns considered?
What do the Ukrainians in Transcarpathia support?
What do people from Bohemia and Silesia use that is the same?
What are Moravians considered part of?
What are parts of the Upper Moravia sometimes considered?

context:
^1 Also considered part of Rusyns
^2 Considered transitional between Ukrainians and Belarusians
^3 The ethnic affiliation of <a0_0>the Lemkos<a0_0/> has become <b4_0>an ideological conflict<b4_0/>. It has been alleged that among the Lemkos the idea of "<b5_0>Carpatho-Ruthenian" nation<b5_0/> is supported only by Lemkos residing in <a1_0>Transcarpathia and abroad<a1_0/>
^4 Most inhabitants of historic Moravia considered themselves as <a2_0>Czechs<a2_0/> but significant amount declared their Moravian nationality, different from that Czech (although people from Bohemia and Moravia use the same official <b6_0>language<b6_0/>).
^5 Also considered Poles.
^6 There are sources that show <a3_0>Silesians<a3_0/> as part of <b7_0>the Poles<b7_0/>. Parts of the southmost population of Upper Silesia is sometimes considered <b8_0>Czech<b8_0/> (controversial).
